title: Terrorism Attacks in Kandahar Afghanistan
name: Terrorism Attacks in Kandahar Afghanistan
description: From the National Counter Terrorism Center, Worldwide Incidents Tracking System data from 2/28/2008 to 2/28/2011

properties.summary: On 5 August 2009, in Kandahar, Afghanistan, assailants took several humanitarian workers hostage while hijacking their vehicle. The victims were left at the scene when the assailants departed. No group claimed responsibility.

On 12 June 2009, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, assailants detonated a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) near a mobile police patrol, killing three police officers, wounding two others, one civilian, and damaging one police vehicle. No group claimed responsibility.
On 18 September 2010, at about 11:30 AM, near Zheray, Kandahar, Afghanistan, armed assailants hijacked a passenger bus full of passengers. No group claimed responsibility.
On 13 August 2010, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, assailants fired upon and killed one engineer. No group claimed responsibility.

On 4 February 2010, at about 7:30 PM, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, a suicide bomber detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) targeting security forces, killing five civilians and one child, wounding 20 civilians, and damaging two shops, one hotel, and one house. The Taliban claimed responsibility.
On 20 August 2010, in the night, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, armed assailants fired on a police patrol at their post but caused no injuries or damage. No group claimed responsibility.

On 13 July 2010, at 9:30 PM, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, a suicide bomber detonated a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) targeting a police headquarters building, then other assailants threw grenades and fired rocket-propelled grenades (RPG) and small arms at the building, killing three North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) soldiers, five civilian contractors, and one police officer; wounding three police officers; and damaging the police building. The Taliban claimed responsibility.
On 28 March 2008, in Kandahar, Kandahar, Afghanistan, armed assailants fired upon and killed a government official. No group claimed responsibility.

On 17 March 2009, in the morning, in Panjva'i, Kandahar, Afghanistan, armed assailants fired on a police patrol, killing five police officers and destroying their vehicle. The Taliban claimed responsibility.
